website_summaries.verdict: Polk Audio's UltraFit 2000 features a comfortable, secure fit, and sounds like a more expensive pair of headphones, making it an ideal budget exercise option.
pros: Powerful audio performance with no distortion, even on deep bass at high volumes
cons: Leaks audio?others nearby will hear your music
Controls are on-ear, not on cable, requiring blind operation

customer_reviews.title: Buttons malfunction, not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous pair of Polk headphones and while they were comfortable, functionality was limited. Why I tried these. While comfortable, the buttons on the right earpiece don't work at all on my LG V10 or any other device I have. Only upside is that they fit my large head and that's rare. But Polk has sold me their last headset. My previous pair lasted less than 6 months before shorting out. The fact that the hardware buttons didn't work out of the box is downright sad. I'm done dealing with Polk.
customer_reviews.author: Mr SoAndSo

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have used many ear buds and headphones with my Pocket PCs, iPods, and iPhone. The on-wire inline controls for iDevices are a great convenience. The on-ear controls for the Polk headphones are better still. However, long ago I found that Sony's behind-the-head band design can interfere with a raised collar in cold weather. I bought a replacement design that connects the ear pieces with wires, without the rigid neck band. The Polk neck band isn't as long or as intrusive as the Sony, but I think replacing the hard band with just flexible wires would be the ultimate improvement. Until then, these Polk headphones are the best design I have found!
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit, Speakers Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: It has a good fit around the head, but one thing I noticed is that people around you can hear what you are listening to as the lack of fully cupping the ear and keeping the sound directed in your ear really makes it noisy for others around you when you listen to loud music. In car driving situations I have to default back to earbuds because passengers can hear the noise of my music too loud coming from these earphones, but I do use them for working out at the gym and they never fall off and stay put when I run hard on the stair master and other training equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Justin R. Germino

customer_reviews.title: 3 months of regular gym use and they are breaking down - bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Decided to pay a bit more in order to get something more quality that would last a bit longer. Alas, they've started giving out already - sound in one of the headphones cuts in and out. 3 months of jogging should not break down a pair of headphones made for that kind of use, esp not for the price they are charging. They are offering a warranty to replace them but they were difficult to deal with and seems to intentionally make it a pain in the ass to replace them. My search continues :(
customer_reviews.author: M.J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound, Good for Running
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for headphones with excellent sound quality to use while running and these meet that goal. I had to bump up the bass a bit on my Sansa Fuze compared to my Sennheiser PX 100, perhaps the little player doesn't quite have enough juice to drive these headphones, but once I did that the sound was very full and every bit as good. The Polk stay in place a little better than the PX 100 too. My biggest caveat is that the Polk is aesthetically a little bulky, although they don't feel heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Random Feature

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones....they are absolutely perfect. Why? They are not earbuds and sit easily over the ear. They stay in place. The sound of music is good. Phone conversations are easy. I like the behind the head band vs over the head band. A Quality product. Also included were jack adapter, and ear covers! I have been searching for months as I cannot wear the earbud types....these are great!
customer_reviews.author: SavvyOnyx

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these headphones to wear with my iphone while I run. They are sturdy and comfortable. I decided to use the silicon earpads. They are also very comfortable. The sound quality it good and the controls work exactly as I expected. I have no problems adjusting the volume or skipping songs. I do not find that it puts too much pressure on my ear, I also have small hands and am able to hold the earphone while I push the button. An added bonus is that it works with my Lifeproof iphone case without using the extender!
customer_reviews.author: nannersmell

customer_reviews.title: alot of money for short term phones
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is very good. Did not hold up to active exercising as advertised. Got these for running based on recommendations from advertising and reviewers. Sounds quality great. ear-fit great. After 5 months noticed sound shorting out. Seems to be attributed to a short in the cord. I think the jostling from running was enough to break the internal wire or soldering at plug connection. In any case, I am very disappointed because they are advertised as being for rigorous exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Isaacs

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a couple months
customer_reviews.text: I used these for working out. Decided to spend a little more than previously for a decent sounding pair. These sounded good, but the chord connection was bad after a very short time. I would invest in a pair that has a chord that plugs into the actual headphones, so if you pull the chord or it gets snagged, it comes right out.
customer_reviews.author: andy coppinger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Really good sound, bass sounds great. Ergonomics are impressive, it contours very well to your neck and is very comfortable during long runs (3-9 miles). The tangle free cord is a great asset as it truly is tangle free, the accessories are also well designed, has different speaker covers to be used during different seasons. Will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AR123

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved
customer_reviews.text: I exercise regularly and developed a habit of using my noise cancelling headphones including my Bose QC15. Atfer vigorous movements and excessice sweating, my QC15's earpads broke apart and could not get Bose to deliver a replacement to my current location. Fortunately, all these was mitigated by the speedy arrival of this product - not a Bose
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound, compact
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair after the first pair met an untimely death by accident. (My fault) I love these because they fit behind the head which enables me to wear them riding a bike with my helmet on. I don't like up ear buds so this worked out as a great alternative. And for the price they can't be beat after searching quite a while before I bought the first set. Lastly, I love the controls directly on the earpiece which means I don't have to go into my pocket to pause, or control volume when talking with someone.
customer_reviews.author: RDP

customer_reviews.title: Started malfunctioning pretty quickly
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were awesome for the first 2-3 weeks. They didn't slip off my ears while running or hitting the punching bag like my other ones. But then after the first month they began to mess up on the right side. It cuts out a lot and static is heard instead of music. It'll probably stop working completely in another few days I'm guessing. Good product, just not reliable. I wish I could get a refund or something but its been more than a month since I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Started out well, then deteriorated - Polk 2000
customer_reviews.text: The headphones worked fine for around 8 months. After that, the sound started cracking - most likely an issue with the cable. I use the headphones mainly for running (3-4 times a week). Now the right side of the headphones only works occasionally. Seems, that I am not the only one with this issue. It is a shame, as I actually really liked these headphones. Sound and fit are great. In any case, way too expensive for such poor quality. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: vuk298

customer_reviews.title: Ear pieces lower score
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these headphones is fine, about what you would expect from Polk. Like others, I have had issues with buds while running on the treadmill. These can get a little hot on the ears, but otherwise, I find them superior to buds. I am sure that is matter of taste for most users. My one major complaint are the rubber ear pieces that loop around the ear to hold the headphones in place. Invariably, one side or the other pops out, typically when stored in the much-too-tight case. These pieces slide into a grove on the head band, and it just appears to be a lousy design methodology.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lay

customer_reviews.title: They get rave reviews
customer_reviews.text: My son, who does not enjoy the inner ear headphones, is a big admirer. Although he is a computer science geek, music is his true passion. He plays several instruments and says these headphones produce a nice sound and are perfect for his gym workouts.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: This is my gift for my brother.. He ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my gift for my brother..He loves it when he jogging..He said the sounds is soft and smooth..He loves it!!thank you
customer_reviews.author: smile

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best headphones for running, maybe THE best, certainly in this price range. The only thing wrong with any such headphones is that my cat likes to eat the wires. I guess I should go wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Decent for workouts
customer_reviews.text: Neither very comfortable nor great sounding, they are adequate for their task of staying on your head during a workout. Prefer these to earbuds when working up a sweat. Do like the flat, reduced tangle cord.
customer_reviews.author: Irl R. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Way too big
customer_reviews.text: I returned these. They were huge. If you are a runner, do not go with these. I did call the company, and they were great. They helped me find a pair of headphones that are perfect for runners. :)
customer_reviews.author: Runningmom365

customer_reviews.title: perfect gym headphones
customer_reviews.text: i sweat alot, and i have tried literally dozens of headphones from powerbeats to sony and everything in between... these take the cake! havent stopped working or skipped a beat and i really really workout hard.i wear these 6 times a week for about 2 hours each time between gym and running and stretching etc etc
customer_reviews.author: J540

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio UltraFit 2000  Headphones
customer_reviews.text: This product is outstanding....I like the fact that these headphones fit over the ear and not in the ear... They are easy to put on and take off. The sound quailty is outstanding. I would have no problem recommending this product. An excellent buy...
customer_reviews.author: Bradford J. Stallworth

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: While these are not cheap, they work very well with my iPhone 4s. Sound is great and the microphone is an added bonus. I use these while I am working out and they stay put. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Love the controls on the earpiece and they feel and sound as they should. I use them when biking and they stay put, are comfy and deliver much higher quality sound than those lousy earbuds. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Keith R. Konvalinka

customer_reviews.title: Terrific sports headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been tremendously pleased with these Polk headphones. I ordered them to replace a pair of Phillips Actionfit ear hook sports headphones and the sound is so much richer and fuller with terrific base. it is just dramatically much better and the headphones are comfortable and stay in place unlike the Phillips which would continually work their way loose. These are just a great pair of sports headphones.
customer_reviews.author: dirkmartin

customer_reviews.title: Very poor experience. While the sound quality is decent
customer_reviews.text: Very poor experience. While the sound quality is decent, the construction feels flimsy and the headset controls for volume and pause failed after one month. I expected better from Polk.
customer_reviews.author: Academic traveler

customer_reviews.title: great sound at the Gym!
customer_reviews.text: great sound at the Gym! does not block too much outside sound, but its safer that way. The rubber earpieces keep dry when working out. Great lows and highs. Compared with other headphones, best value..
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Loya

customer_reviews.title: Nice features but so-so sound
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for replacements for Koss KSC75 ear-clip headphones. I liked the features of these Polks, but the audio performance was nowhere near as detailed in the treble. Also, the rear headband hit my backpack and collar. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: W. White

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT HEADPHONES!
customer_reviews.text: I own MANY headphones, as well as being an avid audiophile. Here is my take on the Ultrafit 2000's Controls...Excellent, work FLAWLESSLY every time! Flat Cord...Will not tangle! Sound...Polk, all the way (Great)! If I HAD to say one thing negative, I would say they could be a bit more snug to the ear. However, that being said, bass does NOT suffer from the fit being a tad loose. All in all, for working out...I LOVE THESE HEADPHONES!
customer_reviews.author: MUSTGTGUY

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the splurge
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several cheaper models of around-the-neck or "street" style headphones for running over the last 10 years. Most were Sony, and they would only last me one running season. At $30 a pop it was getting annoying..... So I thought I would splurge on these and am glad I did! They have several really nice premium features, sound great, and most importantly (for me) they comfortably keep the ear piece in the ideal sweet spot so you don't have to crank the volume on your device!
customer_reviews.author: Ken R

customer_reviews.title: Bad after one year.
customer_reviews.text: I have been on a search for the perfect running headphone. I liked that this ones fit over the ear, as most other ones are in-ear--I find those are tricky to fit. The sound was pretty decent, and they were sweat-proof for about a year. They have now stopped working on one side--not so sweat-proof after all.
customer_reviews.author: JSOLO

customer_reviews.title: Great for workouts
customer_reviews.text: I love these for workouts. They stay on and the sound is excellent. The cord is long without being too long and the on-ear controls are a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: stevethrewup

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but just ok
customer_reviews.text: Expected more form Polk based on their ability and the cost of this product. My much cheaper Sony Sport Headphones sound much better..
customer_reviews.author: Ed Mockler

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Although the audio controls on the earpiece never worked, I could live with that, but after a little over a year the sound only comes out of one ear most of the time. Interesting that it has a one-year warranty....Anyway, I would not recommend this. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Leipziger

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: These stay in place well while jogging, with good sound, but if they were tighter, the sound would be improved.
customer_reviews.author: FredI

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: its actually designed for apple products used it with my DNA it works but you cant use the controls so looking to get an ipod as soon as I sell my DINC2
customer_reviews.author: Amos & Netta

customer_reviews.title: Has Good Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Since this item was given as a gift, I can only relate how the person who received it felt. They really liked the qquality of the sound and the fact that these headphones go around the back of the neck and not directly over the head.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mayers

customer_reviews.title: The sound is fine and I really like the behind-the-neck style as opposed ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound is fine and I really like the behind-the-neck style as opposed to over-the-head, but the volume controls are not intuitive and don't always work with my i-pod.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: These have a mic, I guess you can use them with a phone. Most of my music players only get one channel or the other depending on how far you push in the pin.
customer_reviews.author: Elwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones fit great and stay on ears during workout. Not only do they stay on but they sound GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barnhill

customer_reviews.title: try before buying
customer_reviews.text: sound is very good, quality is good, but too loose on my head when working out and no way to tighten them for a better fit. need some stiffening of the band or adjustment so will work for different sized and shaped heads.
customer_reviews.author: monte k.

customer_reviews.title: nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I should have read reviews first. I never had trouble with the sound (good for price) or fit (i have a skinny head - so everything fits), but after 3 weeks and 5 uses, the right earphone cuts out when i'm running. It would cost me $25 to return it, so i can't even do that. I'll never buy electronic online again. What a nightmare and a waste of 50 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not what they seem...
customer_reviews.text: The box advertised that the headphones would come with an array of accessories such as different ear pads, etc. Upon arrival all that was in the box was one set of headphones with a set of ear pads already on and that was it. They are good quality, but the cord is quite short, and they do not come as advertised. Will not be purchasing from this merchant again...
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Galvin

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones at the gym. Superior sound
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones for jogging
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy these headphones. Lightweight, really good sound and quite stable during training. The only aspect I don't really like is the poor fit when wearing glasses. I didn't realize it prior to purchasing them! Knowing that I would probably go with an in-ear model instead.
customer_reviews.author: Stephane Allard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: just got these, they sound great and fit really nice, got them for bike riding .... I have a 2nd generation video iPod so the headphone auto buttons wont work; but if I upgrade I'll have that function @ my fingure tips, get these U will not be disappointed .. Mike
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Polk Ultrafit 2000
customer_reviews.text: My reason to buy these was simple - I wanted to get great audio and not have to adjust headphones every couple seconds. These more than accomplish those meager goals and my earbuds are now donated to my kids :) These sound really good, are very comfortable and natural feeling and do not move throughout my workout. The have tangle free cords, ipod adjustments on the speaker, volume control and a mic for connection a phone. It's a very well designed product and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mytmauro

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: The sound is almost comparable to more expensive products. My only concern is that the over the ear piece hurts my ears.
customer_reviews.author: germal

customer_reviews.title: Really good headphones
customer_reviews.text: I wear these headphones while working out. They fit well after getting used to wearing them on the back of my head they don't seem to move around much. I really like the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Workout warrior

customer_reviews.title: great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great for the size of these headphones. hold on very good comfortable fit. best behind neck for money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good sport headphone
customer_reviews.text: I have tried heaps of "sports" headphones. These sounds good for overt the ear, nothing mind blowing but good enough during a workout or run. Comfortable and stable fit even when sprinting. Overall a good set.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Headphones
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves these and it made a great Xmas gift. They are great quality and light weight. thanks, Nancy
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Silva

customer_reviews.title: Was Great Until the 1/8 Inch Adaptor Broke.
customer_reviews.text: The 1/8 adaptor got all messed up after only a month or two of regular runs. I was hoping that investing a little more in nice running headphones would pay off for me in the end, but no - this was an epic waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Newton

customer_reviews.title: Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I heard all the great reviews on this product so I went ahead and bought them. The sound quality is good but as in all plastic products, it can only last so long. I just did not know they would only last a couple of months before cracking.
customer_reviews.author: Hershey

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product, it's very affortable price wise. What you get for what you paid is great, sound quality is great, its very comfortable, and stylist. I would recomemded to anybody who wants a great pair of headphones that look good and that are not bulky as others.
customer_reviews.author: Tobeze

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Was just was I was looking for. Ear buds would not always stay in my ear when exercising. These headphones are just what I need when exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great for exercise but not so great if u like to blast ur music...
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. They're great for runners but not the best if ur just using them to commute. Everyone can hear ur music because u have to put it to the loudest to hear the music the way u want it.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Ideal running headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Ideal running headphones. Impressive attention and intention to each detail. Was hoping they would also be good headphones for my daily train commute but they are not intended to keep out background noise.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Unable to give 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: So far I like these headphones a lot. The fit is close to perfect, just a little tighter would be best. I have NO clue as to how to change or add different ear pads that came with item.... Maybe I will wait for an eight year old to show me how? Pretty sad. I do appreciate the tangle free cord, as it is easy to clip to sweats during morning walks. So far so good, just wish I could easily change the various ear pads for a tighter fit, without damaging unit...
customer_reviews.author: JIM C

customer_reviews.title: sound is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: if you like the style of over the ear headphones you will be very happy with these! I think the sound better then my Bose earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: David C Xenitelis

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: One of my friends purchased one of these and brought it into work. I was doubtful that the performance would be much. What a surprise. I listened to a couple of tunes on Pandora, gave the headphones back, logged into my Amazon account and ordered myself the same set. Got em within a few days. My wife was impressed as well and asked if I could order her the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Allen

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is reasonably good but the fit is quite uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio Ultrafit 2000
customer_reviews.text: These are the best ear phones I have ever worn! The base is great! They feel good while you wear them and they don't wobble or move on your head when you run or jog.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Penna

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: They did not work well when I got them. Shorted wire. Eventually became unusable. Also uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: John Beckworth

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones for the price decent fit and great sound although they do leak a bit at high volume over all I would recomend them.
customer_reviews.author: Frank R

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.  Better than many that advertise they have remote capabilities.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Sound is fine. Remote works, unlike other supposedly "remote" headsets. I've tried a number of other headphones that advertise themselves as having remote capabilities, but the controls are so cheaply made that they don't work. This set works.
customer_reviews.author: The Fan

customer_reviews.title: Embarrassed
customer_reviews.text: I had to purchase these for my employer, the box was completely smashed. I opened and the interior box was dusty, smashed, and looks used. Thanks for making me look incompetent and a slob at my job. I gave it two stars because it actually arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Handy

customer_reviews.title: Do not function as stereo headphones????
customer_reviews.text: Great for using with smartphone, built in mic etc. BUT simply will not play with ordinary stereo headphone jacks which is why I bought them -- they are useless for the purpose they were purchased. They really should tell you where they will not work or what sort of adapter you would need to buy to get them to work. I would give them zero stars if I could
customer_reviews.author: Michael Senkinc

customer_reviews.title: their okay
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good...Not as much bass as i would have thought. My biggest issue is the Ear guard continues to come off after a while of wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Gamar

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these every day for working out and loves the product. It was a gift and he loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Schmidty

customer_reviews.title: Happy with headphones
customer_reviews.text: Good sound. Much happier than with the in-ear earbuds. I've even used them over a hat and they don't slip and can hear fine.
customer_reviews.author: Effie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 months ago, used daily for about an hour. Phones would auto skip songs on Samsung galaxy since purchased, very frustrating. Now left ear piece without sound. Like the feel and wear, hate the reliability and function with Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: seanburson

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Headphones
customer_reviews.text: The Polk Audio headphones were purchased because my experience with the Polk Audio brand has been good. I was disappointed because the phones are at best mediocre. Because of the modest price of the headphones, they are worth it. I have used them for hours without any listener fatigue.(Think baseball games). I would recommend them for any person who would use them when they exercise. The bass is good, mid-range fair, and treble is weak. I have purchased many products from Amazon with great confidence. Amazon is a leader in quality customer service.
customer_reviews.author: shep

customer_reviews.title: Breaks within days
customer_reviews.text: Have ordered 2 pairs of these and one broke 3 weeks in and the other broke 2 days in. Terrible waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Ben C.

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio UltraFit 2000 review
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - The headphones come with a variety of great covers for the actual ear-bad. - Control on the actual headphone is a great idea, finally i'm not looking for the remote on the wire in the middle of a run. Cons: - Design looks a lot better on the photo then in real life - Not so comfortable when wearing glasses that's it, pretty good headphones with great sound. not for those of you who like to blast your ears without anybody hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Shay b

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: First two weeks they work but not they skip and my songs get cut off each time at random points
customer_reviews.author: Charles Jolitz

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it was obvious this was a shoddy product--the wiring to each individual earpiece appears to have been connected with chewing gum, after 30 minutes of use the sound started fading in and out, garbled one moment, barely existent the next before coming booming back. Would not buy another Polk audio device--this was not some ten dollar Kmart blue-light special, but a $70 pair of headphones. You expect much better for that money.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio ultra fit 2000
customer_reviews.text: The worst headset I ever owned.It has a very uncomfortable fit. I am not using this headset at all. I would not recommend it for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: michael torell

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother Buying
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a behind-the-head headset to replace my Philips SHS5200. I was buying new SHS5200's every 3-4 months because of the flimsy cord. The Koss headphones sound and feel good BUT the plug caused a little scratchy sound when new. Now 2 months old and they are unusable because of the plug. Other reviews show others are having the same problem. C'mon Koss plugs are not new, hi-tech items! It appears they are defective but Koss used them anyway. The Koss company makes great audio equipment but they failed on this headset. Into the trash they go.
customer_reviews.author: ricemack

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased Polk Audio products for over 30 years, and know them for quality. Unfortunate these headphones did not live up to their reputation. The connector did not make a good connection with a standard 3.5mm jack, and there was a lot of scratchy background noise. Sent these back, and bought a pair of Philips for a quarter the price, and they are working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne P.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't receive anything.
customer_reviews.text: I never got these Polk Audio Headphones. I was charged for it and now it's been almost two months. I can't seem to get any response from anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: On ear controls
customer_reviews.text: The on-ear controls on the right earpiece do not work!!!!!! Hate it when a product you order does not work as advertised!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Clyde

product_meta.title: Polk Audio UltraFit 2000 Headphones - Black (ULTRAFIT 2000BLK)
product_meta.description:
Polk Audio's new UltraFit Sports Headphone Series is a rethinking from the ground up of performance, comfort and durability the three characteristics serious athletes need most in a pair of headphones. Serious music lovers too will value the UltraFit Series because of its undeniably impressive sonic performance. The UltraFit 2000 is an on ear design for anyone uncomfortable with ear buds or in ear headphones. The headphones' SecureFit support ensures a snug yet comfortable fit. The headphones also afford light noise suppression, so you're more aware of your surroundings. On ear 3 button control and in line microphone enable you to use your iPod or iPhone.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Designed from the ground-up to meet the rigorous needs of the athlete and perfect for any active listener, UltraFit Sports headphones will be the last headphone you'll ever need to buy.

The UltraFit 2000 is an on-ear design for anyone preferring this style over ear buds or in-ear headphones. This headphone also affords light noise suppression, so you're more aware of your surroundings. The headphones' SecureFit™ support ensures a snug yet comfortable fit. On-ear 3-button control and in-line microphone enable you to use your iPod® or iPhone® on the fly.

Key Features

 * High Performance Digital Sound—Exceptional detail, full fidelity and deep bass to maximize performance.
 * On-Ear 3-Button Remote Control & Microphone—Use your iPhone and iPod on the fly with built-in controls.
 * SecureFit™ Support—Exercise or play knowing your headphones will stay comfortably in place.
 * Ultra Flexible Tangled-Free Planar Audio Cables—Avoid cable tangle and unwanted microphonics with oxygen-free cables in two custom lengths.
 * StrainGuard™—Kevlar core and computer designed transitional connections eliminate cable failure.
 * Moisture Shield—Resists moisture and keeps performing through strenuous activity.
 * Airframe Design—Combining aerodynamics, materials technology and manufactured to achieve the ideal balance of performance, comfort and reliability.
 * Reflective Wrap-Around Headband—Highly reflective insert offers additional safety through improved visibility.
 * 3.5 mm Connector—Designed to fit through the opening on all cases.
 * Engineered For Durability & Comfort—Made with the latest materials and performance technology to take punishment while staying comfortable.

Why you should consider this product

 If you love to exercise or listen to music while on the go, Polk Audio UltraFit headphones are designed for you. UltraFit headphones deliver a richer, more natural sound that makes whatever you're doing more enjoyable. Their fit and comfort will practically make you forget you're even wearing them. UltraFit headphones were designed to stand up to professional athlete's demanding workouts, so you know they'll go the distance with you. It's one of the reasons the UltraFit Series will be the last headphone you ever need to buy. The UltraFit 2000 is an on-ear design for anyone uncomfortable with ear buds or in-ear headphones. The headphones' SecureFit™ support ensures a snug yet comfortable fit. The headphones also afford light noise suppression, so you're more aware of your surroundings. An on-ear 3-button control and in-line microphone enable you to use your iPod® or iPhone®. 

Take a look inside this product

 1. Dynamic Balance® Polymer Drivers. UltraFit Sport Headphones employ dynamic drivers much like those in our full size speakers. To meet our pre-determined performance parameters, our engineers took the same care designing the drivers, even adding a discrete crossover filter to each driver to naturalize the high frequencies.
 2. Ported Enclosures. UltraFit Sports Headphones are ported. There is the port (ear piece) you put in your ear. But the big deal is the very small channels in the back of the driver enclosure, beneath the Polk logo. These are crucial to tuning the driver's frequency response peaks. And that means a better sounding pair of headphones.
 3. Ultra Flexible Tangle-free Planar Audio Cable. Round cables, coiling up and twisting are a constant source of annoyance because they get in the way of your workout. Eventually constant twisting means the cable will break or pull out at the end. The UltraFit's planar design (with oxygen-free wire for better conductivity) completely eliminates coiling, so the headphone cables won't tangle up during a workout, or when stored away. The planar design also eliminates micro-phonics, the tendency of an electronic device to turn a mechanical vibration into "noise," which you hear in other headphones. 
 4. Moisture Shield. No headphone works well in a sweat bath of moisture. So we added Moisture Shield, a filter that provides two benefits. A thin scrim on UltraFit 2000 driver screen, the filter material resists moisture that could get to the driver; the headphones keep performing through strenuous activity. Moisture Shield also provides an acoustic barrier to help smooth frequency response.
 5. SecureFit™ Support. You're ready for your workout. You put on your headphones and get to work. The last thing you want is for an earpiece to fall out, instantly breaking your rhythm. SecureFit Support includes an ergonomically designed flexible ear hook that wraps around your ear, so the headphone stays in place, even during strenuous exercise. With SecureFit Support, you'll experience a snug yet comfortable fit.
 6. StrainGuard™. UltraFit Sports Headphones have been designed with this in mind. Strainguard™ is a protective system that addresses the areas where sports headphones fail most often. A Kevlar core that houses the speaker wire provides extra tensile strength to prevent the wire from being pulled apart at common failure points - the transitions between cable and the connectors and at the headphones. In the UltraFit Series, all transitional connections are computer designed to strengthen the points where they fail most.
 7. Environmental Awareness. Being aware of your surroundings is always important when you use a pair of headphones. In the gym, on the track or walking through the neighborhood, you want to be able to have a sense of what's going on around you. The UltraFit 2000 offers light noise reduction.
    
    

In the Box

 * Headphones
 * Protective Case
 * 1 Pair Silicone Ear Pads
 * 2 Pairs Foam Ear Pads
 * 1 Pair Cold Weather Shearling Ear Pads
 * Nokia® Connection Adaptor
 * Shirt Clip
 * Warranty: One Year Limited parts and labor

To setup and operate this product

Download the Quick Fit Guide

Download the Manual

Watch the Video

Technical Specifications

UltraFit 2000 Sensitivity 105db Impedance 32 ohms Aprox Weight 2.5oz (71gm) Frequency Response 20Hz-23Khz Style On Ear Behind the Neck Band Transducer Type Dynamic Balance® Transducer Diameter 30mm Push To Hear Yes Built-in Microphone Yes, In-Line Input Connections 3.5mm Finishes Black & Red, White & Orange Parts Warranty 1 Year Labor Warranty 1 Year Included Cables 46" Flat Included Ear Pads MicroFoam, Silicon, Shearling Included Accessories Nokia® Adapter, Moisture Resistant Soft Case, Shirt Clip, Quick Start Guide and Manual 1To ensure a valid warranty, Polk loudspeakers must be purchased at an Authorized Polk Audio home or car loudspeaker Dealer such as Amazon.com. (If you're not sure a dealer is "authorized," call Polk Audio at 1-800-377-7655, and ask us.) The warranty is not transferrable, that means it applies only to the original purchaser. If you purchase your speakers from a private individual, that product is considered "used" and has NO factory warranty, no matter what the seller implies. The warranty is VOID if the serial number of the speaker has been removed or defaced. If you have any questions about your warranty coverage, or you think you need service, call Polk Customer Service at 1-800-377-7655. We're here to help you get the most from your new speakers!

On Ear 3 Button Remote Control & Microphone; Use your iPhone and iPod on the fly with built in controls
SecureFit Support; Exercise or play knowing your headphones will stay comfortably in place
Ultra Flexible Tangled Free Planar Audio Cables; Avoid cable tangle and unwanted microphonics with oxygen free cables in two custom lengths
StrainGuard Kevlar core and computer designed transitional connections eliminate cable failure
